intro: Swida cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician willow, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a slender, often crooked trunk. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth margin and a silvery underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring, followed by narrow, elongated fruits. This species is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas.
